location: An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.

lines.text: Enter the BASTARD and HUBERT, severally

lines.speaker: hubert
lines.text: Who's there? speak, ho! speak quickly, or I shoot.

lines.speaker: bastard
lines.text: A friend. What art thou?

lines.speaker: hubert
lines.text: Of the part of England.

lines.speaker: bastard
lines.text: Whither dost thou go?

lines.speaker: hubert
lines.text: What's that to thee? why may not I demand Of thine affairs, as well as thou of mine?

lines.speaker: bastard
lines.text: Hubert, I think?

lines.speaker: hubert
lines.text: Thou hast a perfect thought: I will upon all hazards well believe Thou art my friend, that know'st my tongue so well. Who art thou?

lines.speaker: bastard
lines.text: Who thou wilt: and if thou please, Thou mayst befriend me so much as to think I come one way of the Plantagenets.

lines.speaker: hubert
lines.text: Unkind remembrance! thou and eyeless night Have done me shame: brave soldier, pardon me, That any accent breaking from thy tongue Should 'scape the true acquaintance of mine ear.

lines.speaker: bastard
lines.text: Come, come; sans compliment, what news abroad?

lines.speaker: hubert
lines.text: Why, here walk I in the black brow of night, To find you out.

lines.speaker: bastard
lines.text: Brief, then; and what's the news?

lines.speaker: hubert
lines.text: O, my sweet sir, news fitting to the night, Black, fearful, comfortless and horrible.

lines.speaker: bastard
lines.text: Show me the very wound of this ill news: I am no woman, I'll not swoon at it.

lines.speaker: hubert
lines.text: The king, I fear, is poison'd by a monk: I left him almost speechless; and broke out To acquaint you with this evil, that you might The better arm you to the sudden time, Than if you had at leisure known of this.

lines.speaker: bastard
lines.text: How did he take it? who did taste to him?

lines.speaker: hubert
lines.text: A monk, I tell you; a resolved villain, Whose bowels suddenly burst out: the king Yet speaks and peradventure may recover.

lines.speaker: bastard
lines.text: Who didst thou leave to tend his majesty?

lines.speaker: hubert
lines.text: Why, know you not? the lords are all come back, And brought Prince Henry in their company; At whose request the king hath pardon'd them, And they are all about his majesty.

lines.speaker: bastard
lines.text: Withhold thine indignation, mighty heaven, And tempt us not to bear above our power! I'll tell tree, Hubert, half my power this night, Passing these flats, are taken by the tide; These Lincoln Washes have devoured them; Myself, well mounted, hardly have escaped. Away before: conduct me to the king; I doubt he will be dead or ere I come.
Exeunt
